parts.text:
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF 11240060), which is typically associated with electoral campaign materials in Romania.  This strongly suggests the post is related to electoral propaganda.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly names Iosifescu Victor-Ion as a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies in Dâmbovița County.  The image clearly shows the candidate and the text "Votează reper" (Vote for REPER) further reinforces the connection to a specific candidate and party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The targeting parameters (age, gender, location) further confirm its intention to reach a broad segment of the population in Dâmbovița County.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Iosifescu Victor-Ion and the REPER party in the parliamentary elections. The phrase "Votează reper" (Vote for REPER) and the highlighting of the candidate's name and affiliation leave no doubt about the post's electoral intent. The message "Tourism brings economic development!" is clearly intended to appeal to voters and promote the candidate's platform.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present information in a journalistic manner. It lacks objectivity and instead promotes a specific candidate and party.  It is not an analysis or opinion piece but a direct appeal for votes.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clearly structured political advertisement designed to influence voting behavior. The statement about tourism is presented as a campaign promise, not a personal reflection.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1304837790688838</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, identified by ad_archive_id 1304837790688838, fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It directly refers to a specific candidate (Iosifescu Victor-Ion), is clearly intended to influence the vote in favor of the REPER party, targets a wide audience in Dâmbovița County, and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's timing, after the official end of the campaign period, is a significant factor.  While the ad's end date is after the election, the fact that it was active during the period when such ads are prohibited is a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>IOSIFESCU VICTOR-ION</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>REPER</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
REPER Dâmbovița, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame electorale plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 1304837790688838) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatul IOSIFESCU VICTOR-ION pentru Camera Deputaților în județul Dâmbovița, utilizând imaginea acestuia și îndemnul explicit „Votează reper”, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului și partidului REPER.  Reclama, cu un buget de sub 100 RON, a atins între 1000 și 2000 de impresii, având o estimare a acoperirii de 50.000-100.000 de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library.  Informațiile de contact ale advertiserului sunt: steluta.munteanu@partidulreper.ro și +40720412010.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei electorale, conform legislației în vigoare.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
